title: Cognitive Load Measurement and Optimization Design in Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computation skills and foundational understanding of cognitive load theory
context.additional_context: Real-time cognitive load data collection and analysis utilizing learners' personal mobile devices (BYOD). Measurement and comparative evaluation of cognitive load during project teams' mathematical problem-solving processes.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the differences between intrinsic, extraneous, and germane cognitive load with 80% accuracy.
Learners can collect and interpret data using EEG-based cognitive load measurement tools (N1/P2 component analysis) when performing PBL tasks.
Learners can compare cognitive load patterns based on math problem types (carryover operations/digit representation methods) and propose effective learning design strategies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
